description:
OS-Quota_Sets currently requires you to specify a project id in the request uri, this is unecessary because the project_id is located in the context as context.project_id.


currently:
url/OS-Quota-Sets/show/1234
url/OS-Quota-Sets/defaults/1234
url/OS-Quota-Sets/update/1234

could be:
url/OS-Quota-Sets/show
url/OS-Quota-Sets/default
url/OS-Quota-Sets/update
title: OS-Quota-Sets extension has redundant request uri

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alex-meade

comments.content:
I'm not sure that this bug is valid.

The os-quota-sets extension was created primarily for admins to view and manage quotas on a per project/tenant basis. So in that sense the project/tenant name is generally required.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jakedahn

comments.content:
Good, I was going to ping you for your input on this.

The weird part is that tenant ids are now included in all requests, so if I wanted to show the quotas for project 123 I would do.

GET http://novaurl/v1.1/123/os-quota-sets/123

This also allows for something like

GET http://novaurl/v1.1/124/os-quota-sets/123

Which it doesn't make much sense to be doing a request to the project 124 when I am getting info on 123.

I am proposing that we take the first project id in the uri and no longer need the other one. Thoughts on this?
